Let us Eradicate Mosquito!

Mosquitoes are one of the deadliest animals in the world - WHO

  • Their ability to carry and spread disease to humans causes millions of deaths every year. In 2015 malaria alone caused 438 000 deaths.
  • The worldwide incidence of dengue has risen 30-fold in the past 30 years, and more countries are reporting their first outbreaks of the disease. Zika, dengue, chikungunya, and yellow fever are all transmitted to humans by the Aedes aegypti mosquito.
  • More than half of the worldâ€™s population live in areas where this mosquito species is present. Sustained mosquito control efforts are important to prevent outbreaks from these diseases.
  • There are several different types of mosquitoes and some have the ability to carry many different diseases.
